page.title: 18Interesting People
page.content: On the 17th June we interviewed Lady Shakerley and Mrs. Margaret Hill who have lived in Petworth nearly all their lives. They remembered what Petworth was like quite a while ago when Mr. Baxter was blacksmith in Park Road. People of Petworth used to bring their horses to have horseshoes made and mended. They also remembered Mr. Knight. When the Fair couldn't come during the War, Mr. Knight would put up a wooden stall in the Square to sell things and keep the royal charter going. In the old schools they didn't go on school trips until 1951 when Mr. Hill was headmaster. They also recalled that there were 6 schools, 3 state schools and 3 private schools. The Infants School was on the site of the new library, The Boy's School was in North St., the girls in East St.
